record.name: Java SE
record.description: Java Platform, Standard Edition (Java SE) is a widely used platform for developing and deploying enterprise scale applications. It provides the core set of APIs and tools needed to build robust, scalable, and secure Java applications.

record.name: Spring Boot
record.description: Spring Boot is a framework that simplifies the development of new Spring applications. It provides opinionated defaults to get you up and running as quickly as possible, with minimal upfront configuration.

record.name: Spring Cloud Gateway
record.description: Spring Cloud Gateway is a library for routing to APIs and providing cross-cutting concerns to them such as: security, monitoring/metrics, and resiliency.

record.name: React UI
record.description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create large web applications that can change data, without reloading the page.

record.name: Docker
record.description: Docker is a platform that uses OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers. Containers are isolated from one another and bundle their own software, libraries and configuration files; they can communicate with each other through well-defined channels.

record.name: Kubernetes
record.description: Kubernetes, also known as K8s, is an open source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

record.name: SMPP
record.description: Short Message Peer-to-Peer (SMPP) is an open, industry standard protocol designed to provide a flexible data communications interface for the transfer of short message data between External Short Message Entities (ESME), Routing Entities (RE) and Message Centres.
